ollowing form:
Two weeks from today at 4:37 you are going to be doing exactlywhat you
will be doing.



376
CHAPTER 16 ■Fallacies of Vacuity
Of course, whatever you are doing at that time will be exactly what you are
doing, so this prediction cannot possibly be wrong. But this is only because
it does not tell us anything in particular about the future. Whateverhappens,
the prediction is going to be true, and this is just what is wrong with it. The
prediction is emptyor vacuous.
People do not, of
